Here are the steps to figure this out:
Express the total cost of 8 pounds of feathers and 2 ounces of gold in a mathematical equation.
Express the total cost of 14 pounds of feathers and 3 ounces of gold in another mathematical equation.
Use these equations to set up a system of equations where:
- The quantity of feathers is represented by the variable \(f\) (cost per pound of feathers).
- The quantity of gold is represented by the variable \(g\) (cost per ounce of gold).
Solve this system of equations to find the values of \(f\) and \(g\).
Use the found values of \(f\) and \(g\) to calculate the cost of 5 pounds of feathers and 5 ounces of gold using the formula \(5f + 5g\).
